summary: Up in Smoke: a marauders era rp To deny the war became impossible the day the Death Eaters attacked Diagon Alley. It happened in...
caption:
Up in Smoke: a marauders era rp

To deny the war became impossible the day the Death Eaters attacked Diagon Alley. It happened in the middle of day, in August while Hogwarts students were shopping for supplies and families were enjoying their morning. Seven killed and a dozen more injured. Peace in the wizarding world was over, ambivalence no longer an option. To the Death Eaters, you are one of them or you are the enemy. To fight against them paints a target on your back.

Even so, there are some who have chosen to fight - whether they a part of Dumbledore’s only whispered of group, the Order, or if they are finding some other way of resisting. They dream of a better world than this one, and they are not afraid to fight for that world - whatever the cost may be.

This is not the same world the Marauders knew when they were at Hogwarts. 1979 does not hold any of the sheltered hallways of their school days. There are questions of how much of the Dark Lord has infiltrated the ministry and the only thing you can trust in the papers are the obituaries. The illusion of safety is gone, and it is time to pick a side. War is burning, and you must decide where you stand.

More than just the illusion will go up in smoke.

Main ll Owls ll App Form ll Characters ll Map

summary:
Scorpius: I can't believe your dad is Harry Potter!
Albus: Yes, well, I know he killed Voldemort and stuff but he's just my...
body:
Scorpius: I can't believe your dad is Harry Potter!
Albus: Yes, well, I know he killed Voldemort and stuff but he's just my dad
Scorpius: Oh, yeah, he killed You Know Who
Albus: What were you talking about?
Scorpius: He was my dad's... crush? hero? when they were at Hogwarts

summary: AU: Crime Boss!Harry Potter, Straight A student!Tom Riddle - The first time Tom met Harry was when he was illegally working...
body:
AU: Crime Boss!Harry Potter, Straight A student!Tom Riddle

- The first time Tom met Harry was when he was illegally working part-time in a shady bar. He thought the boy with too big green eyes who tried to flirt with him was annoyingly pretty but harmless. He was wrong.

- Harry spotted a beautiful man in the new opening bar in his territory. Tall and handsome, with captivating maroon eyes, he was exactly his type. Tom was working in the bar, so Harry stupidly assumed he was familiar with what was going on in the shadow of London. And Tom must be of legal age. He was fucking wrong.

- In which Harry Potter is the feared crime boss of London with too much power and perfect family. Meanwhile, Tom Riddle is a straight A student with trouble past, struggling to escape his abusing home and make it out of this glamorous city alive.

- Also, Tom was fifteen. Harry was going to fucking murder someone, possibly the fucker who had hired a freaking minor to work in his bar.

- I see lots of mafia-boss!Tom with naive-boy!Harry around, let’s change the dynamic and see how it goes :)))

summary: James calls Maria “Dora the Explorer” because of Teddy mentioning wanting to name her after his mother Nymphadora and he cannot...
body:
James calls Maria “Dora the Explorer” because of Teddy mentioning wanting to name her after his mother Nymphadora and he cannot get the song out of his head every time he sees her.

He likes Maria more than his actually sisters.

summary: Of course, Slytherin do have a couple of foibles: their issues with Muggles, a terrifying serpent emblem, and that dreadful chap...
body:
Of course, Slytherin do have a couple of foibles: their issues with Muggles, a terrifying serpent emblem, and that dreadful chap Lord Voldemort. But if you do get Sorted into this house, there is absolutely no need to be down about it. This ancient community has just as much to offer as the other three houses, despite all evidence to the contrary.

Not every Slytherin is a total git

It’s a common misconception that Slytherin house is host to every dark wizard imaginable. Alright, so its founder, Salazar Slytherin, had a tendency to target Muggle-born students with a terrifying giant snake in a specially-made Chamber every now and then… And fair enough, Lord Voldemort is more or less the most evil force in wizarding history. But it’s not all doom and gloom!

Take one of Hogwarts’ most esteemed professors, Severus Snape, who gave his life for the greater good, all in the name of love.

How about Regulus Black, Sirius Black’s brother, who famously defected from being a Death Eater in order to try and vanquish one of Lord Voldemort’s Horcruxes? Nymphadora Tonks’s mother, Andromeda, defied the pure-blood traditions of her family (which included her sister Bellatrix Lestrange) to marry a Muggle-born: a very un-Slytherin sort of thing to do. And as for wily old Horace Slughorn, he may have had some skeletons in his cupboard, but in the end he shone true in the great Battle of Hogwarts.

The common room is quite picturesque, you know

Unlike the other houses, Slytherin’s common room is situated deep in the dungeons of Hogwarts, surrounded by the school’s Great Lake. Its décor includes a crackling fireplace, carved chairs and greenish lamps – which actually sounds quite homey. And dungeons, smungeons. What’s not to love about a nice, Gothic feng shui?

One of the greatest wizards ever known was a Slytherin

Slytherin’s repute is always going to be ever so slightly tarnished by the fact that pesky Lord Voldemort was a staunch house member who embodied every Slytherin stereotype going. But not much is said of the fact that one of the most famous wizards of all time, Merlin, was also from the house. So beloved and great was Merlin, that to this day, wizards are awarded The Order of Merlin to celebrate an outstanding achievement. Proof that even Gregory Goyle may one day turn into a great inspiration. Okay, maybe not.

Snakes are cool

And while we’re defending things, let’s also hear it for snakes – the Slytherin emblem. We can understand that sometimes serpents have some poisonous tendencies that also relate to a few of Slytherin’s alumni, and yes, sometimes snakes can be murderous Basilisks or even secret Horcruxes, but don’t hold that against them. Snakes are some of nature’s most resourceful creatures, and if life weighs down on them, they shed their skin and start anew. Some Slytherins, including a certain Draco Malfoy, have been known to do this too.

Slytherins are born winners

When Harry first joined Hogwarts, Slytherins reigned supreme. They had ‘flattened’ Gryffindor on the Quidditch pitch and were on course to win the House Cup for the seventh time in a row before Harry, Ron and Hermione put an end to that. Now, if Slytherins were so terrible, where did all those house points come from? And since when was being good at sport a crime? Perhaps everyone who has a go at Slytherin is just a bad loser.

Who doesn’t look good in green?

Let’s be honest. If we had to pick between a glorious emerald dress robe and a ghastly yellow one, we’d pick the former every time. (Sorry, Hufflepuff.)

blog.name: kai-watertribe
blog.title: Hey, welcome~
blog.description: Welcome, hope you have fun here~

summary: I try to be productive and integrate into society but i always wind up slithering down the street trying to find he who must not...
body: I try to be productive and integrate into society but i always wind up slithering down the street trying to find he who must not be named

reblog.comment: I try to be productive and integrate into society but i always wind up slithering down the street trying to find he who must not be named
